Ни при каких обстоятельствах не покупайте эту каловую массу. Вы всрете бабки. И уж тем более не покупайте DLC - зря потратите деньги. Кстати об этом. Разрабам на игру давным давно похуй. Похуй настолько, что у каждого второго тут накрученные предметы и DLC. Игра крайне не сбалансирована. Половина игроков - долбоебы на имбалансных манах типа легиона, доктора и т.п. Еще раз повторюсь: в игре баланса нет от слова "совсем", а с каждой новой обновой они пробивают дно, которое, как казалось, нельзя пробить. Игроки жалуются на ОП мана доктора? А давайте еще баффнем его! НЕ ПОКУПАЙТЕ ЭТУ ИГРУ! Поначалу вам может показаться что игра интересная. Да, это так. Но весь интерес к игре напрочь отбивают несбалансированные убийцы и еще более несбалансированные аддоны на них.

As a big horror fan, this game hits a niche that no other games seem to quite hit. Gameplay is straightforward for both sides: survivor has to complete objectives to escape and the killer has to stop them. Community opinion towards balance is divisive (as most games are), but I've always found ways to adapt to changes and have fun. Developer support for this game has been regular and consistent, ensuring that the playerbase has largely remained active for quite some time. Despite the repetitive nature of gameplay, I've found myself always coming back to this game and finding new ways to have fun. This is a great game to play with friends and I've had many funny memories playing. 
The greatest shortcoming of this game is it's community. Toxicity and entitlement are rampant on both sides, with the whole sweaty "it's everybody else's fault except for my own" mentality being very pervasive. However, this is common in most multiplayer games and it's best just to ignore trash talk as a reality of gaming. Secondly, there are enough "good guys' that are willing to give advice in the community to counterbalance the toxicity.
Ultimately, Dead by Daylight is a game that I feel is worth the price and more, especially if you fancy yourself a fan of horror movies. The repetitive nature of the game is overshadowed by how dynamic it can be at times, and I encourage new players (and current) to approach the game with a laid back attitude. There aren't many games out there that can have Ash Williams running from Ghost Face inside Jigsaw's lair, and this game really hits the nail on the head in that regard.
Great game to play with friends if your group of friends like horror games.

I've had a long-running love-hate relationship with Dead by Daylight. On the one hand, I love when, as a survivor, I'm canny and stealthy enough to avoid the killer's notice for the whole game or use my wits to outsmart them in a chase; or when, as a killer, I can use what I've learned as a survivor to predict their movements and tactics in a chase, or put the genuine frighteners on them by pulling off something like a Coxcombed Clapper + "The Ghost" Soot combo on Wraith, coming out of absolutely nowhere because they can't hear me over the sound of the generator they're repairing. I have so many fantastic memories about playing this game.

But for every legitimately good game and fun time I've had, there's two or even three really bad ones. I play both sides of the coin regularly, so I can fully understand that the playing field is uneven, and in the survivors' favor. Now, this isn't the part where I wank about how "exhaustion perks like Sprint Burst are overpowered" or how "killers with insta-down powers are ridiculous" or anything like that (even though, objectively speaking, there are many perks that are simply pure wastes of a slot, same for add-ons). The perks are designed the way they are to give the extra advantages they need, if in a bit of a hand-holding sort of way. The issue primarily lies within the community, and the many toxic feedback loops that are created between survivors and killers (particularly those who only play one side and can't be bothered to try the other). Skilled survivors taunt, teabag, and post-game lobby trash-talk, and skilled killers aren't innocent of the same. Of course, no one's entitled to a "fair, fun game", as both sides each have a clear objective to do, no matter the cost: survive and sacrifice. But it's entirely possible to lose and still enjoy yourself doing it. Some of my most enjoyable games were ones where not even a single survivor was sacrificed, but both sides gave each other a damn good fight and everyone walked out with multiple tens of thousands of blood points for the efforts, and the post-game lobby was lit up with GGs and compliments toward both sides from both sides.

I think DBD would benefit quite a lot not only from some honest-to-goodness mechanics tweaking (referencing dead perks, lame add-ons, changes to things that have removed the threat from some killers, like the Deep Wounds change that made Legion basically worthless), but from a shift in mindset in the community that plays it. For as much as every match is "killer versus survivors" and "you versus everyone else" and so on, keeping a positive attitude in any game, on either side, will make this game's future all the brighter. Compliment the killer on a good catch, give survivors props for ducking you in a chase and getting away, both sides give tips to one another based on how the game went to help everyone improve. A fantastic game like this is only as alive and reputable as the community that plays and supports it, after all.

Good luck out there in the Fog, fellow survivors, and happy hunting and satisfying sacrifice, fellow killers.

Back in March of 2020 I recommended this game. This is no longer the case. The developers of Dead by Daylight have done everything in their power to sabotage their own game. Every other update is filled with bugs and none of the "fixes" or "updates" are ever any good. One of the most recent chapters broke the game in so many areas that I uninstalled. I reinstalled as these issues seemed to be at least partially fixed. I got to play all of 3 games before another patch was released which completely broke the game again. For a game making so much money and with such a massive following this is inexcusable. The developers have also shown multiple times that they don't listen to player feedback in any way. Statistics taken from low level games are used to balance killers. A UI "update" was recently released that no one asked for. That "update" completely ruined the user interface and made the game unplayable. Do NOT purchase this game. It is a terrible use of your time and your funds.
